page.title: 06RESERVOIR WORK.
page.content: The reservoirs have to be checked daily for water levels, depth soundings have to be taken regularly on the dam banks to make sure there is no leakage. At different locations on the water courses there are iron grids fitted so that at a time of flooding, branches of trees, leaves and debris are trapped and can be cleared away. Also, if flooding occurs the water can be directed straight into the Woodburn river. At different intervals silt which washes into the water courses from the streams and rivers has to be cleaned out, briars and grass need to be cut back. The water is treated and filtered by micro-strainers before being fed to Belfast at a rate of eight million gallons per day. At present in 1985 the work force is eleven men.
